semantic_title: Mental and Behavioral Disorders Due to Psychoactive Substance Use - In Remission
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 5. Chapter 5: Mental, Behavioral and Neurodevelopmental disorders > b. Mental and behavioral disorders due to psychoactive substance use > 1) In Remission

content.full_text: Selection of codes describing 'in remission' for categories F10-F19, Mental and behavioral disorders due to psychoactive substance use (categories F10-F19 with -.11, -.21, -.91) requires the provider's clinical judgment and are assigned only on the basis of provider documentation (as defined in the Official Guidelines for Coding and Reporting), unless otherwise instructed by the classification. Mild substance use disorders in early or sustained remission are classified to the appropriate codes for substance abuse in remission, and moderate or severe substance use disorders in early or sustained remission are classified to the appropriate codes for substance dependence in remission. (Evidence: pg no: 43, L35-L41)
content.summary: Establishes requirements for coding substance use disorders in remission, emphasizing provider documentation and clinical judgment while distinguishing between abuse and dependence remission coding (Evidence: pg no: 43, L35-L41)
key_concepts: Provider clinical judgment requirement (Evidence: pg no: 43, L37-L38)
Provider documentation requirement (Evidence: pg no: 43, L38-L39)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Remission codes require provider's clinical judgment (Evidence: pg no: 43, L37-L38)
detailed_rules.explanation: Only providers can make the clinical determination that a patient is in remission from substance use disorders (Evidence: pg no: 43, L37-L38)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign only based on provider documentation (Evidence: pg no: 43, L38-L39)
detailed_rules.explanation: Remission codes cannot be assigned without explicit provider documentation as defined in the Official Guidelines (Evidence: pg no: 43, L38-L39)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Mild disorders in remission classified as abuse in remission (Evidence: pg no: 43, L41)
detailed_rules.explanation: Mild substance use disorders in early or sustained remission use abuse remission codes (Evidence: pg no: 43, L41)

detailed_rules.explanation: Moderate or severe substance use disorders in early or sustained remission use dependence remission codes (Evidence: pg no: 43, L41)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Verify provider has documented remission status
Step 2: Confirm provider's clinical judgment supports remission
Step 3: Determine original severity (mild vs moderate/severe)
Step 4: If mild, use abuse remission codes (.11)
Step 5: If moderate/severe, use dependence remission codes (.21)
Step 6: Specify early vs sustained remission if documented
